markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Archaeologist Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1879) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 156 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Archaeologist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=46)

**Prerequisites**
trained in Perception; Trained in [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14); Trained in [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17)

</column>

---

You are a student of peoples and their histories, and are in constant pursuit of knowledge and artifacts from the past. You become an expert in [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) and [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17), and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) about ancient history, peoples, and cultures.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the archaeologist archetype.

<title level="2">Archaeologist Dedication leads to...</title>
[Archaeologist's Luck](/Feats.aspx?ID=1883), [Greater Magical Scholastics](/Feats.aspx?ID=1884), [Magical Scholastics](/Feats.aspx?ID=1880), [Scholastic Identification](/Feats.aspx?ID=1882), [Settlement Scholastics](/Feats.aspx?ID=1881), [We're on the List](/Feats.aspx?ID=4132)
name: Archaeologist Dedication
prerequisite: trained in Perception; Trained in Society; Trained in Thievery
prerequisite_markdown: trained in Perception; Trained in [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14); Trained in [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17)
